subject: Bug-tizen: TC-1695 file error in su utility Bug: the utility su provided by the package util-linux is searching to the file /etc/defaults/su.
commitMessage:
Bug-tizen: TC-1695 file error in su utility
Bug: the utility su provided by the package util-linux
is searching to the file /etc/defaults/su.

changed the defaults in code to default.

Change-Id: I7c20ad40bba10aa89d132cd9a80d84542f57adf2
Signed-off-by: chunqiangx <chunqiangx.tang@intel.com>

comments.message: Uploaded patch set 1.

Patch Set 1: Verified+1

before testing this patch,
need two steps:
1.  comment two lines, ENV_PATH and ENV_ROOTPATH, in file /etc/login.defs
2.  change ALWAYS_SET_PATH=no to ALWAYS_SET_PATH=yes in file /etc/default/su

after these operations, execute su command,
when su succeeded, 
execute command export | grep PATH

the path is the value of ENV_SUPATH in /etc/default/su.
Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1
Patch Set 1: Verified+1 Code-Review+2
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

- Tag: submit/tizen/20141021.125646
- Commit: a98e51c7aed9d654d3340bb23fe1a41c46f5ab6f Bug-tizen: TC-1695 file error in su utility Bug: the utility su provided by the package util-linux is searching to the file /etc/defaults/su.

subject: Bug-Tizen: TC-294 Bug: https://bugs.tizen.org/jira/browse/TC-294?filter=-1 Setting default user to 'User' for tty sessions. This change provides default user consistency for tty, ssh and wayland console sessions.
commitMessage:
Bug-Tizen: TC-294
Bug: https://bugs.tizen.org/jira/browse/TC-294?filter=-1
Setting default user to 'User' for tty sessions.
This change provides default user consistency for tty, ssh and
wayland console sessions.

Added whitespace

Change-Id: I94f449e051ffc5eb03d46508726776babfa059b5
Signed-off-by: John L. Whiteman <john.l.whiteman@intel.com>

comments.message: Uploaded patch set 1.

Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

The whitespace trailing...

Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

Fix the trailing whitespace, and Bob's your uncle.
Uploaded patch set 2.

Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

Thank you. Please verify.

Patch Set 2: Verified+1

[OK]: Build (fresh fetch from gerrit url, i586)
[OK]: RPM Installation (NDiS 166 2nd Generation Intel(R) Processor)
[OK]: Reboot
[OK]: gbs export

Before Installation
cat /proc/self/attr/current
tty (ctrl-f2): System

After Installation
cat /proc/self/attr/current
tty (ctrl-f2): User
login invocation via wayland terminal: User
wayland terminal: User
ssh: User
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: blkid: enable evaluate by scan
commitMessage:
blkid: enable evaluate by scan

Device tokens (UUID etc.) are resolved using either udev by-[token]
symlinks or by scanning the disks.

There's a race condition between when udev symlinks are created and
when systemd runs systemd-remount-fs. The race is triggered if
/etc/fstab uses UUIDs to identify partitions.

Enable evaluate by scan as a fallback if udev symlinks are not found.

Fixes: TIVI-1121

Signed-off-by: Mikko Ylinen <mikko.ylinen@intel.com>
Signed-off-by: William Douglas <william.douglas@intel.com>
Change-Id: Ic8c57cb542de59f1413f0ffebce2408ac7420623

subject: Enable mountpoint utility
commitMessage:
Enable mountpoint utility

On RSA util-linux provided mount, umount and mountpoint. On new Tizen
3.0 repos util-linux provided mount and umount but not mountpoint. This
patch is connected with commmit 571c63fc8ee16cf8cfde11e78ac6f8ec961c9dba
from platform/upstream/busybox (removal of mount, umount and mountpoint
from busybox).

Change-Id: I0f68097b5a36ed7e1df36869782cc53939fcebb7
Signed-off-by: Maciej Wereski <m.wereski@partner.samsung.com>

comments.message: Uploaded patch set 2.
Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1
Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

Patch Set 2:

this is a trivial change, however it would help a lot if you add a few words with the background and how is that useful and where this will used...

Patch Set 2:

Please do add some more commentary.  Add mountpoint for what?  Why is this needed as opposed to the functionality that was already there?

Patch Set 2:

Also, does Change-Id: Id77bbdb4b2aad629fd92a527d0b15f3175f11f5a depend on this for it's functionality?  If so, does this change affect non-busybox systems?

Patch Set 2:

Ryan, it's good to paste the change URL. :-), too hard to find where is the exact Change-Id.
Patch Set 2: Verified+1
Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

Patch Set 2:

Anas, Ryan:

On RSA util-linux provided mount, umount and mountpoint, not busybox. On new Tizen 3.0 repos util-linux provided mount and umount but not mountpoint. Also busybox had enabled mount utilities, which was confusing. Do you want me to amend commit and add this background?

Also this change is connected with Id77bbdb4b2aad629fd92a527d0b15f3175f11f5a, where I removed mountpoint (otherwise I'd remove mountpoint utility from platform, which woul be a regression).
Uploaded patch set 3.

 standard       i586           succeeded
Patch Set 3: Verified+1 Code-Review+1

Patch Set 3:

Hmm, this is tizen.org open to public, I think it's good not bring some internal term, for example, RSA here.
Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1
Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.
